A Festival for the dead is held once a year in Japan. This is a traditional festival in Japan and many celebrations are held. This festival is a cheerful occasion , for _ this day, the dead are said to return to their homes and they are _ by the living. _ they are expected to be hungry after their long journey, food is laid out for them. Specially-made lanterns are hung outside each house to help the dead to find their way. All night long, people dance and sing. In the early morning, the food that has been laid out for the dead is thrown into a river or into the sea as it is considered _ for anyone living to eat it. In towns that are near the sea, the small lanterns which had been hung in the streets the night before are put into the water when the festival is over.
Thousands of lanterns slowly drift out to sea _ the dead on their return journey to the other world. It is moving, and crowds of people stand on the shore watching the lanterns go away _ they can be seen no more.
